TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Tuning specific to a single type of BusinessEmployee.

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description: The Career that employees of this type will have applied to them.

TunableList.name: career_level_delta_buffs
TunableList.description: A dictionary mapping the delta in career level and desired career level to a buff that is applied when employee matches the delta. e.g. A Sim is hired at their desired career level. They would be awarded the buff corresponding to entry '0'. e.g. A Sim is hired at a level 2 employee but desires to be level 5. They would be awarded the buff corresponding to '-3'.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The buff to be awarded when the specified difference between career level and desired career level matches.

Tunable.name: employee_count_default
Tunable.description: The number of this type of employee the player will be able to hire by default

Tunable.name: employee_count_max
Tunable.description: The maximum number of employees allowed to be hired. This assumes all perks have been unlocked.

TunableList.name: employee_skills
TunableList.description: A mapping of employee skills to their data.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: A skill on the employee. The Sim Filter that generates this employee should also apply this skill.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The data associated with the tuned employee skill.

Tunable.name: business_summary_description
Tunable.description: The description displayed in the business summary UI for this skill.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: The weight of this skill's completion level. This is used to compute a weighted average of skill completion. e.g. If all skills are maxed out, and their weights are all 100%, the average completion is 100%. If there are two skills, both maxed out, one of which has a 50% weight while the other has a 100% weight, the average completion is 75%.

Tunable.name: interaction_demote
Tunable.description: The interaction to run when demoting this type of employee via the UI.

Tunable.name: interaction_fire
Tunable.description: The interaction to run when firing this type of employee via the UI.

Tunable.name: interaction_hire
Tunable.description: The interaction to run when hiring this type of employee via the UI.

Tunable.name: interaction_promote
Tunable.description: The interaction to run when promoting this type of employee via the UI.

Tunable.name: job_icon
Tunable.description: The icon for this business job.

Tunable.name: job_name
Tunable.description: The name of this business job.

Tunable.name: potential_employee_pool_filter
Tunable.description: The filter to use when looking at Sims to hire this employee type.

Tunable.name: potential_employee_pool_size
Tunable.description: The number of Sims shown in the hire picker. If you want the cap raised, you'll need to chat with a GPE. There are performance concerns with generating too many SimInfos.

Tunable.name: satisfaction_commodity
Tunable.description: The commodity representing this employee type's satisfaction. Its states are used to populate the UI for the business.

Tunable.name: uniform_male
Tunable.description: The SimInfo file to use when editing male uniforms for this employee type.

Tunable.name: uniform_pose
Tunable.description: The post that mannequins in CAS are in when designing the uniform for this employee type.

Tunable.name: weighted_skill_to_career_level_ratio
Tunable.display: Weighted Skill To Career Level Ratio
Tunable.description: The ratio between the computed weighted average of the employee skills and the desired career level within the retail career. e.g. All skills are equally weighted, and the average skill level is 50% completion. If this value is 100%, then the employee will start in (and desire to be), at 50% progression within the career. If this value is 50%, then the employee will start in (and desire to be), at 25% progression within the career.
